intro: Eleogiton scabra, commonly known as the rough eleogiton, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Eleogiton scabra is often found in moist, tropical or subtropical environments, growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
